description: North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile as US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Seoul to take part in a Summit for Democracy.
title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile as Blinken Visits Seoul

description: Washington’s aggressive use of sanctions and heightened partisanship are shaking foreigners’ faith in the US currency, according to an exclusive excerpt of Paper Soldiers.
title: Dollar’s Superpower Status at Risk From Turmoil at Home and Abroad

description: Investors in TikTok’s Chinese parent company stand to benefit if it sold the app because divestment would remove a source of uncertainty, a Republican lawmaker said.
title: ByteDance Investors Could Win in TikTok Sale, GOP Lawmaker Says

description: Vladimir Putin secured another six years as Russia’s president to step up his war in Ukraine and challenge the West, with the Kremlin claiming record public support for him in a vote whose outcome was pre-determined.
title: Putin Takes Record Election Win to Press Russia’s War in Ukraine

description: Germany and France joined 12 other European Union countries in calling for the European Investment Bank to enhance its financing for defense as a means to boost the bloc’s security in light of Russian aggression.
title: Germany, France Lead Call for EIB to Step Up Defense Financing

description: Polish farmers started blocking a key highway near the German border to protest against food imports from Ukraine and the European Union’s climate initiatives regarding agriculture.
title: Polish Farmers Block Key Highway Near German Border

description: The European Union pledged a €7.4 billion ($8.1 billion) aid package for Egypt, the latest push by the international community to buoy the struggling economy of a North African nation seen as vital to regional stability.
title: EU Boosts Ties With Egypt Through €7.4 Billion Aid Package

description: South Sudan’s government ordered all of the nation’s schools to close indefinitely because of a heat wave that could see temperatures rise to as high as 45C (113F).
title: Sustained Heat Wave Shutters Schools Indefinitely in South Sudan

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed on Sunday to press on with the war against Hamas by sending troops into the southern Gaza city of Rafah, despite what he said was mounting global pressure for a cease-fire.
title: Netanyahu Vows to Continue War, Pushes Back on Schumer Criticism

description: President Joe Biden is regularly promoting signs of a strengthening economy and easing inflation, but when it comes to the indicator closest to home, it’s a tough sell.
title: Grocery Prices Have Soared. That’s Spoiling Biden’s Economic Pitch.

description: Klaas Knot, president, De Nederlandsche Bank N.V., speaks during the Institute of International Finance (IIF) annual membership meeting in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, Oct. 12, 2022. This year's conference theme is "The Search for Stability in an Era of Uncertainty, Realignment and Transformation." Photographer: Ting Shen/Bloomberg
title: New Dutch Government Must Be Strict on Finances, Central Banker Says

description: President Joe Biden raised more than $53 million for his reelection campaign and the Democratic Party in February, a record amount for the month.
title: Biden Raised $53 Million in February, Boosting Record War Chest

description: Russia enters the final day of its presidential election with Vladimir Putin poised to clinch a new term to pursue his war in Ukraine and confrontation with the West.
title: Putin Heads for Victory in Russia Election Without Real Opponent

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The big news this week, President Joe Biden said at a weekend Washington roast, was that two candidates had clinched their party's nomination for president. But one was too old, too mentally unfit for the job, he said.
title: Biden Jokes That of 2 Presidential Candidates, 1 Was Mentally Unfit. 'The Other's Me'

description: Indonesia said two of its nationals are involved in a South Korean investigation into a possible data leak around a fighter jet that’s being jointly developed by both countries.
title: Two Indonesians Assisting in South Korea Fighter Jet Probe
